results.title: Luxembourg
results.brief_description: Brief travelogue describing Luxembourg, capital of the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg. Shows typical street scenes, the market in the main square - the Place Guillaume, the Palace of the Grand Duchess and nearby Mondorf-les-Bains famous for its spa waters, the Caisse d’Epargne, the famous bridge - the Pont Adolphe.

results.title: Luther Metke at 94
results.creator_credit: Jorge Preloran, Steve Raymen, Richard Hawkins and Ethnographic Film Program
results.brief_description: A portrait of Luther Metke who has lived in this Cascade Mountains of Oregon since 1907. Tells how he was a veteran of the Spanish American War, an early labor organiser, a poet, and a builder, and today serves as a vital and lucid example of the rural ethic in America.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jorge Preloran, Steve Raymen, Richard Hawkins and Ethnographic Film Program

results.title: Lungs
results.creator_credit: A K Lee, D Morgan and Educational Media International
results.brief_description: Discusses the structure, function and mechanism of the lungs. The overall structure of the lungs and air passage is presented by means of a sheep dissection and a living lung is seen during a routine operationat a veterinary clinic. The movement of the diaphragm and ribs is clearly highlighted by X-ray.

results.title: Low impact technology: solar heating
results.creator_credit: Ron V. Brown and R and R Productions
results.brief_description: Experiments with solar energy have been carried out for many years, especially domestic solar hot water and heating systems. Architects, and scientists from the CSIRO and the University of Melbourne comment on the types and requirements of today’s solar heating systems, and how they can be used domestically and industrially. Photography by John Ruane.

results.title: Louis Armstrong
results.brief_description: A biographical portrait of musician, actor and world traveller, Louis Armstrong. Provides a glimpse of his life and career using still photos and clips from his feature films.

results.title: Lost highways: the roadside photography of Richard Szymczuk
results.brief_description: A fascinating look into the world of Australian photographer Richard Szymczuk and his passion for the urban/industrial landscape of Geelong and its surrounding environs. Since 1987 Richard has been on a mission photographing old rundown servos, milkbars, general stores, billboards, factories, recording history before it literally disappears or is replaced. His photographs have become an art form of social expression and reflect today’s society of economic rationalism. In the film Richard talks about his background, his work and his philosophy on life reflecting on the ever-changing landscape as evidenced by the many examples of his photographic works and his revisits to some of the original locales that feature throughout the documentary. Photographed by Simon Anderson with Simon Kirby and music by Steven Baker.

results.title: Looking at Leeuwin
results.creator_credit: Australia. Navy Office. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Royal Australian Navy’s Junior Recruit Training establishment HMAS Leeuwin at Fremantle in Western Australia. Shows junior recruits at academic and practical classes, on board a Navy destroyer and at sport and play. Discusses further opportunities for junior recruits after their graduation.

results.title: Looking at children's movements (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The study of movement in human beings is beginning to be treated scientifically, and a study is being made of infants from birth. It seems likely that predictions can be made from the study of an infant’s movements about his or her attitudes and character throughout life. Contains b&w sequences.
